aboutContent.missionStatement: To foster community spirit by sharing wholesome, homemade dishes made from organic and natural ingredients.

foodStandards.title: Food Standards
foodStandards.subtitle: Organic and Natural Ingredients
items: All dishes should be made primarily with organic and/or naturally grown produce and meats (if applicable).
Avoid processed items containing artificial flavors, colors, or preservatives.
When possible, source from local farms or community gardens.
Each person should bring a dish that can serve about 6â€“8 people.

sections.title: Cooking or Donation Requirement
items: Every local participant must do at least one of the following each time they attend:
- Bring a fully prepared dish that meets the event's food standards.
- Contribute a monetary donation (suggested minimum: $5 for children above 7 and $10 for 13+)
Attendance is contingent on fulfilling at least one role: cooking, donating, or volunteering.

sections.title: Travelers and Guests
items: Anyone visiting from out of town or a first-time local guest may attend one meal for free per year, no obligations.
If they wish to attend more frequently, they must abide by the same participation rules as regular attendees.

sections.title: Consistent Attendance without Participation Policy
items: If a regular attendee comes multiple times without bringing a dish or donating, event organizers may politely remind them of these rules.
Continued non-participation will result in losing the privilege to attend future potlucks.

volunteerRole.title: The Volunteer Role
items: Volunteer to arrive 30 minutes early to arrange tables, put out utensils, and help anyone who needs carrying food, etc.
Arrange dishes and supplies on tables according to the order someone would select them.
Afterwards clean up all tables, throw away trash, and clean all tables.
